title: 3 bedroom semi-detached house for sale in Schools Hill, Cheadle, Greater Manchester, SK8
displayAddress: Schools Hill, Cheadle, Greater Manchester, SK8
description:
I am pleased to present this magnificent, semi-detached Edwardian house for sale. Nestled in a prestigious location, this neutrally decorated property offers an abundance of potential to enhance and add value, although it is in need of some updating. The property boasts three spacious reception rooms, all separate and benefitting from large windows. The first reception room, a delightful morning room, provides built-in storage. The second is bay fronted and features a charming fireplace, and the third reception room enjoys a serene garden view, allowing residents to appreciate the greenery while relaxing indoors.The house also offers three double bedrooms, each equipped with built-in wardrobes. The master bedroom is a standout feature of the property, offering the perfect personal sanctuary all of which are complemented by a family bathroom.The kitchen is well-appointed with built-in pantries and benefits from natural light, creating a bright and airy space for culinary pursuits. Downstairs w.c with wash hand basin.Set on a generous elevated plot, the property enjoys a large, imposing presence. The exterior features include parking facilities and a beautiful garden, adding to the overall appeal of the estate. Additionally, the property's location provides easy access to public transport links, excellent schools, and local amenities. It is also close to the A34 bypass and Bruntwood, and green spaces, including nearby parks, are within proximity. In summary, this property presents a unique opportunity for those looking to put their stamp on a substantial home with vast potential. The ideal blend of period charm and modern convenience, it is a must-see for any prospective buyer seeking a home in a sought-after location.
IMPORTANT NOTE TO POTENTIAL PURCHASERS & TENANTS: We endeavour to make our particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. The services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All photographs and measurements have been taken as a guide only and are not precise. Floor plans where included are not to scale and accuracy is not guaranteed. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. POTENTIAL PURCHASERS: Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller. POTENTIAL TENANTS: All properties are available for a minimum length of time, with the exception of short term accommodation. Please contact the branch for details. A security deposit of at least one month’s rent is required. Rent is to be paid one month in advance. It is the tenant’s responsibility to insure any personal possessions. Payment of all utilities including water rates or metered supply and Council Tax is the responsibility of the tenant in most cases. CHE250086/2
descriptionHtml:
I am pleased to present this magnificent, semi-detached Edwardian house for sale. Nestled in a prestigious location, this neutrally decorated property offers an abundance of potential to enhance and add value, although it is in need of some updating.

The property boasts three spacious reception rooms, all separate and benefitting from large windows. The first reception room, a delightful morning room, provides built-in storage. The second is bay fronted and features a charming fireplace, and the third reception room enjoys a serene garden view, allowing residents to appreciate the greenery while relaxing indoors.

The house also offers three double bedrooms, each equipped with built-in wardrobes. The master bedroom is a standout feature of the property, offering the perfect personal sanctuary all of which are complemented by a family bathroom.

The kitchen is well-appointed with built-in pantries and benefits from natural light, creating a bright and airy space for culinary pursuits. Downstairs w.c with wash hand basin.

Set on a generous elevated plot, the property enjoys a large, imposing presence. The exterior features include parking facilities and a beautiful garden, adding to the overall appeal of the estate.

Additionally, the property's location provides easy access to public transport links, excellent schools, and local amenities. It is also close to the A34 bypass and Bruntwood, and green spaces, including nearby parks, are within proximity.

In summary, this property presents a unique opportunity for those looking to put their stamp on a substantial home with vast potential. The ideal blend of period charm and modern convenience, it is a must-see for any prospective buyer seeking a home in a sought-after location.


IMPORTANT NOTE TO POTENTIAL PURCHASERS & TENANTS: We endeavour to make our particulars accurate and reliable, however, they do not constitute or form part of an offer or any contract and none is to be relied upon as statements of representation or fact. The services, systems and appliances listed in this specification have not been tested by us and no guarantee as to their operating ability or efficiency is given. All photographs and measurements have been taken as a guide only and are not precise. Floor plans where included are not to scale and accuracy is not guaranteed. If you require clarification or further information on any points, please contact us, especially if you are traveling some distance to view. POTENTIAL PURCHASERS: Fixtures and fittings other than those mentioned are to be agreed with the seller. POTENTIAL TENANTS: All properties are available for a minimum length of time, with the exception of short term accommodation. Please contact the branch for details. A security deposit of at least one month’s rent is required. Rent is to be paid one month in advance. It is the tenant’s responsibility to insure any personal possessions. Payment of all utilities including water rates or metered supply and Council Tax is the responsibility of the tenant in most cases.

agentDescriptionHtml:
Established in 1868, Reeds Rains has over 150-years of expertise in selling and renting house. During that time our teams have never lost sight of the need for local expertise, building great relationships, being genuinely interested in our customers and getting the job done. It is the only way to provide great customer service and get the best price for your property.

As estate agents, Reeds Rains want to make sure things are straightforward for our customers. Whether you are selling or buying properties, we will be there every step of the way. Our lettings agents are there to make it easy to rent out a property or find your perfect rental home. We also aim to help you achieve your goals and get the job done.

You can trust an agent with over 150 years of expertise.
